comment: Literally the worst. Brushes off questions from students, without giving real answers. Flies through power points quickly, without explaining them well at all. Have to read the textbook, do the homework, and teach yourself the material in order to do well. She doesn't teach at all. Good luck.

You remember that amazing teacher back in high school that inspired you to go out, do great things, and made you feel that the sky was the limit? Well Dr. King is nothing like that. Good luck. Teach yourself, and get an A, but there won't be any help from this lady.

Her tests are so hard and her lectures are boring. She has a "that's just how it is attitude" which is completely unhelpful. She reads off slides and doesn't give straight answers to questions. The tests are taken with iClicker NOT scantrons. Make sure you keep track of when Mastering homework is due because that'll definitely save your grade.

If you can avoid taking this class, by all means do. King will never be there for you and makes tests extremely difficult. I hate Biology now and I just hope that my Biology 2 professor can change that for me again.

Get ready to teach yourself. She tells you to study for specific things, but the tests are completely different material so you can never fully study for what you need. Reads directly from the PP and doesn't explain when questions are asked. She is definitely the worst professor I've ever had. Very unclear, not a good teacher, and an unfair tester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Would be better off teaching an intimate classroom rather than lecture. Misleading when it comes to information you need to know for tests so get ready to utilize mastering and textbook.  Flies through powerpoint slides, but does not post them- have your phone out to take pics in case you think you'll need a figure.  USE mastering practice exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Reads off slides. Mispronounces words constantly. Homework due sporadically instead of all at once or on regular intervals. Tests with iClicker. Responds to questions condescendingly without answering the questions because she doesn't know the answers. Mandatory attendance. I spent 5 years in undergrad, and she is the worst professor I've ever had.
She is an awful teacher. Half the time she has no clue how to do the labs so when we ask she tells everyone something different. I would not recommend her for a lab professor

Three tests with a final exam. The final exam replaces the lowest test grade. Tests are about 60-70 questions long. Expect a group project you have to present in front of the class and online homework about every other week. Class is extremely boring and hardly anybody shows up except for test days. Attendance doesn't matter.

As nice as she is her lectures are awful. I felt bad because less and less people showed up every lecture but toward the end I couldn't take it anymore. Her voice is monotone and she lectures the entire time. We never got out early. Tons of reading and online work. Long and hard tests. I would not take that again.

Dr. King is nice but won't help you if you don't go up to her and ask personally. 3 exams and a final and a final will replace lowest exam grade. Little hw and a group project. I struggled with the exams but she curved my exams because I always went to her office. Her lectures are based on the powerpoints.

I really liked Dr. King. I took her for my gen ed environmental 1101 science class. The lectures are dull most of the time, but her teaching style is straight forward and as long as you really study the power points, skim over the labs, and come to class for the reviews, you should get an A. 3 tests, cumulative final, a bit of homework, & 1 project
She doesn't seem like she is there for the students.  I never went to class because she reads straight from the board and post all of the power points online. She is also very  mono tone.

Your typical science class. Long lectures, expects reading from the book, few tests, 1 presentation and homework grades online. She's very straightforward and nice, the material is just a pain in the butt. Attendance is definitely not required, but make sure you study all of the powerpoints she posts. Don't be surprised if you make a C in the class

She is a great teacher that really cares about her students.  She is very down to Earth, and her teaching style is perfect for students with little science background.  She will reiterate important concepts in class and it is up to you to make sure you know the material for the tests.  Her tests are not difficult at all.

Great teacher, makes you study, her tests are moderate very much over all the information, lots of info given so it can be hard to keep up, she is always is available for help, posts all the info on D2L, go to class read the chapters and turn in the homework , overall great class, differently take another class with her
Pretty nice teacher. Will make you study but she is fair.

This teacher has caused me to absolutely despise Biology. She skims the material in class, then writes incredibly detailed tests that are NOTHING like what she covered. When she hands out a study guide for the test, it's really only covers 1/5 of the test (if she says it's all you need to study, don't believe her). Constantly made grading mistakes.
